2:
In the sight of Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh, stir up your power;\q come and save us.
\q
3:
God, restore us;\q make your face shine on us, and we will be saved.


\q
4:
Yahweh God of hosts,\q how long will you be angry at your people when they pray?
\q
5:
You have fed them with the bread of tears\q and given them tears to drink in great quantities.
\q
6:
You make us something for our neighbors to argue over,\q and our enemies laugh about us among themselves.


\q
7:
God of hosts, restore us;\q make your face shine on us, and we will be saved.
\q
8:
You brought a vine out of Egypt;\q you drove out nations and transplanted it.


\q
9:
You cleared the land for it;\q it took root and filled the land.
\q
10:
The mountains were covered with its shade,\q the cedars of God by its branches.
\q
11:
It sent out its branches as far as the sea\q and its shoots to the Euphrates River.


\q
12:
Why have you broken down its walls\q so that all they who pass by pluck its fruit.
\q
13:
The boars out of the forest ruin it,\q and the beasts of the field feed on it.


\q
14:
Turn back, God of hosts;\q look down from heaven and take notice and take care of this vine.
\q
15:
This is the root that your right hand planted,\q the shoot that you made to grow.
\q
16:
It has been burned and cut down;\q they perish because of your rebuke.


\q
17:
May your hand be on the man of your right hand,\q on the son of man whom you made strong for yourself.
\q
18:
Then we will not turn away from you;\q revive us, and we will call on your name.


\q
19: Yahweh God of hosts, restore us;\q make your face shine on us, and we will be saved.
